citation.article-title: Quadrisphaera granulorum gen. nov., sp. nov., a Gram-positive polyphosphate-accumulating coccus in tetrads or aggregates isolated from aerobic granules
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Quadrisphaera (Qua.dri.sphae′ra. L. pref. numer. adj. quadr- four; L. fem. n. sphaera a ball, globe, sphere; N.L. fem. n. Quadrisphaera fourfold balls, coccus in tetrad).
Gram-positive, non-spore-forming cocci, 1·2–3·0 μm in diameter, occuring in tetrad arrangement, fitting the morphological description of TFOs.
The phylogenetic position is in the family Frankiaceae.
The type species is Quadrisphaera granulorum.
